00020 #ifndef _MSKFileWriter_HEADER_
00021 #define _MSKFileWriter_HEADER_
00022 
00023 /*! \file MSKFileWriter.h This file provides writing capaibilities for MSK files.
00024  */
00025 
00026 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00027 
00028 #include "file/MSKFileData.h"
00029 //
00030 
00031 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00032 
00033 namespace affxmsk
00034 {
00035 
00036 /*! Provides functions to write a MSK file.
00037  *
00038  * The mask file contains two sections. The first section stores a list of probe sets which
00039  * is used by the scaling and normalization functions of the MAS5 algorithm. The second section
00040  * defines the list of probe pairs to ignore in the MAS5 algorithm.
00041  *
00042  * The indicies are stored in the file one based. When read, they are converted to zero based.
00043  */
00044 class CMSKFileWriter : public CMSKFileData
00045 {
00046 public:
00047         /*! Constructor */
00048         CMSKFileWriter();
00049 
00050         /*! Destructor */
00051         ~CMSKFileWriter();
00052 
00053 public:
00054         /*! Sets the array type.
00055          * @param arrayType The probe array type.
00056          */
00057         void SetArrayType(const char *arrayType) { m_strArrayType = arrayType; }
00058 
00059         /*! Saves the data to a MSK file.
00060          *
00061          * @return True if successful
00062          */
00063         bool Save();
00064 
00065         /*! Adds a set of probe indicies to the list.
00066          * @param indicies The probe indicies (the indicies should be one bases here).
00067          */
00068         void AddProbeSetIndicies(const ProbeSetIndiciesType &indicies) { m_Indicies.push_back(indicies); }
00069 
00070         /*! Adds a probe set to the list.
00071          * @param probeSet The probe set to add.
00072          */
00073         void AddProbeSet(const char *probeSet) { m_Sets.push_back(probeSet); }
00074 };
00075 
00076 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00077 
00078 } // namespace

00081 
00082 #endif
